required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Single Dose Trial of Empagliflozin in Children and Adolescents With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Randomised, Multicentre, Single-dose, Parallel Group Trial to Evaluate Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Empagliflozin in Children and Adolescents From 10 to Less Than 18 Years of Age With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to generate pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic data to identify the safe-effective dose of empagliflozin in children and adolescents aged 10 to less than 18 years with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before drug administration (-0:30 hours (h)) and 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 4:00h, 8:00h, 12:00 (Day 1), 24:00 (Day 2), 34:00 (Day 2), 48:00 (Day 3) after drug administration.
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity (AUC0-inf).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before drug administration (-0:30 hours (h)) and 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 4:00h, 8:00h, 12:00 (Day 1), 24:00 (Day 2), 34:00 (Day 2), 48:00 (Day 3) after drug administration.
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUC0-tz).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before drug administration (-0:30 hours (h)) and 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 4:00h, 8:00h, 12:00 (Day 1), 24:00 (Day 2), 34:00 (Day 2), 48:00 (Day 3) after drug administration.
Before drug administration (-0:30 hours (h)) and 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 4:00h, 8:00h, 12:00 (Day 1), 24:00 (Day 2), 34:00 (Day 2), 48:00 (Day 3) after drug administration.
Before drug administration (-0:30 hours (h)) and 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 4:00h, 8:00h, 12:00 (Day 1), 24:00 (Day 2), 34:00 (Day 2), 48:00 (Day 3) after drug administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Urinary Glucose Excretion (UGE) Over 24 h After Study Drug Intake
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Urinary Glucose Excretion (UGE) over 24 h after study drug intake. For the changes from baseline in UGE on Day 1 (0 to 24 h postdose) , adjusted means per treatment group were to be calculated based on an ANCOVA including 'treatment' as a fixed effect and 'UGE at baseline' and 'FPG at baseline' as continuous covariates. Means presented are the adjusted means.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at 24 h After Study Drug Intake
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at 24h after study drug intake. For the change from baseline in FPG at 24 h postdose (in the morning of Day 2), adjusted means per treatment group were to be calculated based on an ANCOVA including 'treatment' as a fixed effect and 'FPG at baseline' as continuous covariate. Means presented are the adjusted means.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 8-point Plasma Glucose Profile Over 24 h After Study Drug Intake
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in 8-point plasma glucose profile over 24h after study drug intake (as defined by change from baseline in Mean Daily Glucose (MDG) calculated at Day 1). For the changes from baseline in MDG on Day 1, adjusted means per treatment group were to be calculated based on an ANCOVA including 'treatment' as fixed effect and 'MDG at baseline' as continuous covariate. Means presented are the adjusted means.

arm_group.description: Patient to receive a high dose of empagliflozin
Patient to receive a medium dose of empagliflozin
Patient to receive a low dose of empagliflozin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Children and adolescents with type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Insufficient glycaemic control (HbA1c <=10.5%) despite diet and exercise and/or metformin and/or stable basal or MDI insulin
- Negative for Islet Cell Antigen and Glutamic Acid Decarboxylase autoantibodies and fasting C-peptide levels >= 0.85 ng/ml
- BMI > 50th percentile for age and sex
Exclusion criteria:
- Uncontrolled hyperglycaemia with a glucose level > 240 mg/dl (> 13.3 mmol/l)
- History of acute metabolic decompensation such as diabetic ketoacidosis within 3 months before the screening visit with the exception of acute de-compensation at the time of type 2 diabetes diagnosis
- Treatment with weight reduction medications within 4 weeks before randomisation

group.title: Empagliflozin 5mg
group.description: Single dose (1 tablet) of 5mg, empagliflozin, film-coated tablet administered orally.

group.title: Empagliflozin 10mg
group.description: Single dose (1 tablet) of 10mg, empagliflozin, film-coated tablet administered orally.

baseline.population: Treated Set (TS): The TS included all patients who were allocated trial medication and had received trial medication (empagliflozin).

outcome.title: AUC0-inf
outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity (AUC0-inf).
outcome.time_frame: Before drug administration (-0:30 hours (h)) and 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 4:00h, 8:00h, 12:00 (Day 1), 24:00 (Day 2), 34:00 (Day 2), 48:00 (Day 3) after drug administration.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Set (PKS): The PKS included all treated patients who provided at least 1 primary or secondary pharmacokinetic parameter for statistical assessment.

group.title: Empagliflozin 5mg
group.description: Single dose (1 tablet) of 5mg, empagliflozin, film-coated tablet administered orally.

group.title: Empagliflozin 10mg

group.title: Empagliflozin 25mg
group.description: Single dose (1 tablet) of 25mg, empagliflozin, film-coated tablet administered orally.

measure.title: AUC0-inf
measure.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity (AUC0-inf).
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Set (PKS): The PKS included all treated patients who provided at least 1 primary or secondary pharmacokinetic parameter for statistical assessment.

analysis.estimate_desc: Dose proportionality was assessed based on a power model that describes the functional relationship between the dose and AUC0-inf. Based on the estimate for the slope parameter β, a 2-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the slope was computed.

outcome.title: AUC0-tz
outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUC0-tz).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Urinary Glucose Excretion (UGE) Over 24 h After Study Drug Intake
outcome.description: Change from baseline in Urinary Glucose Excretion (UGE) over 24 h after study drug intake. For the changes from baseline in UGE on Day 1 (0 to 24 h postdose) , adjusted means per treatment group were to be calculated based on an ANCOVA including ‘treatment’ as a fixed effect and ‘UGE at baseline’ and ‘FPG at baseline’ as continuous covariates. Means presented are the adjusted means.
outcome.population: Treated Set (TS) including patients with UGE data on both visits

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI's intellectual property rights.
